segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!
segments.translated_content: 大家好！

segments.content: Good news: the new React beta docs will be available soon! A link on the old doc invites to visit the new beta site. Gatsby v5 released alpha.
segments.sourceMdx: Good news: the new React beta docs will be available soon! A link on the old doc invites to visit the new beta site. Gatsby v5 released alpha.
segments.translated_content: 好消息：新版React测试版文档即将上线！旧文档页面已添加跳转链接。Gatsby v5已发布alpha版本。

segments.content: The current trend: bringing reactivity to React.
segments.sourceMdx: The current trend: bringing reactivity to React.
segments.translated_content: 当前趋势：为React注入响应式特性。

segments.content: Some nice React-Native content too. We are watching closely the progress of Expo Router, WishList and web support in Reassure.
segments.sourceMdx: Some nice React-Native content too. We are watching closely the progress of Expo Router, WishList and web support in Reassure.
segments.translated_content: 本期也有优质React-Native内容。我们正密切关注Expo Router、WishList以及Reassure中web支持的进展。

segments.content: TypeScript celebrates its 10th anniversary. A `--watch` mode is coming in Node.js. Interesting content about WebAssembly.
segments.sourceMdx: TypeScript celebrates its 10th anniversary. A `--watch` mode is coming in Node.js. Interesting content about WebAssembly.
segments.translated_content: TypeScript迎来十周年庆典。Node.js即将引入`--watch`模式。关于WebAssembly的深度内容值得关注。

segments.content: ## ⚛️ React
segments.sourceMdx: ## ⚛️ React {#react}
segments.translated_content: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

segments.content: **[Gatsby v5 Alpha](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-v5-alpha-is-here-and-its-pretty-exciting/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Gatsby v5 Alpha](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-v5-alpha-is-here-and-its-pretty-exciting/)**
segments.translated_content: **[Gatsby v5 Alpha版发布](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-v5-alpha-is-here-and-its-pretty-exciting/)**

segments.content: The v5 of Gatsby is in alpha with 2 main new features:
segments.sourceMdx: The v5 of Gatsby is in alpha with 2 main new features:
segments.translated_content: Gatsby v5 alpha版本带来两大特性：

segments.content:
* support for [partial hydration](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/a-look-at-partial-hydration-in-gatsby-5/) based on React Server Components and a `"client export"` directive at the top of client components
* the Gatsby Slices API, which allows to significantly improve build times when a shared component (layout/navbar/footer) should be re-rendered
segments.sourceMdx:
- support for [partial hydration](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/a-look-at-partial-hydration-in-gatsby-5/) based on React Server Components and a `"client export"` directive at the top of client components
- the Gatsby Slices API, which allows to significantly improve build times when a shared component (layout/navbar/footer) should be re-rendered
segments.translated_content:
- 基于React服务端组件的[局部水合](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/a-look-at-partial-hydration-in-gatsby-5/)支持，客户端组件顶部需添加`"client export"`指令
- Gatsby Slices API可显著提升公共组件（布局/导航栏/页脚）重新渲染时的构建速度

segments.content: **[Making React fast by default and truly reactive](https://legendapp.com/open-source/legend-state/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Making React fast by default and truly reactive](https://legendapp.com/open-source/legend-state/)**
segments.translated_content: **[通过默认优化实现React真正响应式](https://legendapp.com/open-source/legend-state/)**

segments.content: Interactive article that illustrates the problems of re-rendering in React which is not optimized by default. Shows how the Legend-State library, based on observables, allows to bring reactivity to React (a bit like SolidJS). The code is then optimized by default and avoids unnecessary re-renders.
segments.sourceMdx: Interactive article that illustrates the problems of re-rendering in React which is not optimized by default. Shows how the Legend-State library, based on observables, allows to bring reactivity to React (a bit like SolidJS). The code is then optimized by default and avoids unnecessary re-renders.
segments.translated_content: 深度解析React默认未优化的重复渲染问题。展示基于可观察对象的Legend-State库如何为React注入响应式特性（类似SolidJS），默认优化代码并避免不必要的重渲染。

segments.content: **[Ezno - Experimental compiler](https://kaleidawave.github.io/posts/introducing-ezno/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Ezno - Experimental compiler](https://kaleidawave.github.io/posts/introducing-ezno/)**
segments.translated_content: **[Ezno - 实验性编译器](https://kaleidawave.github.io/posts/introducing-ezno/)**

segments.content: A new experimental type-checking compiler for JavaScript, compatible with TypeScript annotations and JSX. Relies on dependent typing to do advanced static analysis and pre-evaluations at compile-time (reminds [prepack](https://prepack.io/)). The goal seems to be to be able to compile an app that looks like React in a reactive form, and skip the VDOM. Quite technical to read.
segments.sourceMdx: A new experimental type-checking compiler for JavaScript, compatible with TypeScript annotations and JSX. Relies on dependent typing to do advanced static analysis and pre-evaluations at compile-time (reminds [prepack](https://prepack.io/)). The goal seems to be to be able to compile an app that looks like React in a reactive form, and skip the VDOM. Quite technical to read.
segments.translated_content: 兼容TypeScript注解和JSX的新型JavaScript类型检查编译器。通过依赖类型进行高级静态分析和编译时预计算（类似[prepack](https://prepack.io/)），目标是将类React应用编译为响应式形式，跳过VDOM。技术性较强。

segments.content: **[(Lazy) Components Maps](https://julesblom.com/writing/lazy-component-maps)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[(Lazy) Components Maps](https://julesblom.com/writing/lazy-component-maps)**
segments.translated_content: **[（惰性）组件映射](https://julesblom.com/writing/lazy-component-maps)**

segments.content: Presents a useful technique to know to leverage code-splitting when you do conditional rendering. Especially useful on large enums/union-types, such as an `<Icon name="my-icon-name"/>` component.
segments.sourceMdx: Presents a useful technique to know to leverage code-splitting when you do conditional rendering. Especially useful on large enums/union-types, such as an `<Icon name="my-icon-name"/>` component.
segments.translated_content: 介绍在条件渲染时利用代码拆分的实用技巧，特别适用于大型枚举/联合类型场景，例如`<Icon name="my-icon-name"/>`组件。

segments.content: **[Whyframe](https://whyframe.dev/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Whyframe](https://whyframe.dev/)**
segments.translated_content: **[Whyframe](https://whyframe.dev/)**

segments.content: Allows frontend component rendering to be isolated in an iframe. Now supports [Webpack, Next.js and Docusaurus](https://twitter.com/bluwyoo/status/1576947013450539008). This seems handy for component library documentation sites, ensuring the global CSS of the site does not affect the rendering of the component displayed.
segments.sourceMdx: Allows frontend component rendering to be isolated in an iframe. Now supports [Webpack, Next.js and Docusaurus](https://twitter.com/bluwyoo/status/1576947013450539008). This seems handy for component library documentation sites, ensuring the global CSS of the site does not affect the rendering of the component displayed.
segments.translated_content: 允许将前端组件渲染隔离在iframe中。现已支持[Webpack、Next.js和Docusaurus](https://twitter.com/bluwyoo/status/1576947013450539008)。这对于组件库文档站点非常实用，能确保站点的全局CSS不会影响所展示组件的渲染效果。

segments.content:
* 📖 Beta React docs: [useEffect](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575320847279071232) + [useId](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577283961763467265) + ["All the commonly used APIs documented"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575367224541560833)
* 📜 [How to use Serverless Functions with SSR](https://paulie.dev/posts/2022/09/how-to-use-serverless-fucntions-with-ssr/): explains how to correctly split a function between the server/client part in Gatsby
* 📜 [Fastest Frontend Tooling in 2022](https://cpojer.net/posts/fastest-frontend-tooling-in-2022): Christoph Nakazawa justifies the choices behind his minimalist starter [vite-ts-react-tailwind-template](https://github.com/cpojer/vite-ts-react-tailwind-template)
* 📜 [Improving the accessibility of our Next.js site](https://vercel.com/blog/improving-the-accessibility-of-our-nextjs-site)
* 📜 [The Orton Effect - dreamy photo effect in CSS and React](https://mikebifulco.com/posts/orton-effect-css-react)
* 📜 [Mark Erikson - Guide to React Rendering Behavior - updated for React 18](https://twitter.com/acemarke/status/1577301648850014210)
* 🚧 [no-nested-components ESLint rule](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/25360): a new rule could come soon and avoid declaring components on the fly
* 🧵 [Dan Abramov - "skipping re-renders (eg with memo) is a performance optimization only"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575553047408902147)
* 🧵 [Andrew Clark - "We've looked very seriously at a WASM rewrite of React"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1576302675766804480)
* [React Spectrum - React Aria - October 4 releases](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1577370727849680896)
* 📦 [Redwood v3](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/redwood-3-0-0-is-now-available/3989) + [What's new in Redwood v3?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9LFWOxMlTs)
* 📦 [Supabase Pre-built React Auth UI](https://twitter.com/supabase/status/1577215238792916992)
segments.sourceMdx:
- 📖 Beta React docs: [useEffect](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575320847279071232) + [useId](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577283961763467265) + ["All the commonly used APIs documented"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575367224541560833)
- 📜 [How to use Serverless Functions with SSR](https://paulie.dev/posts/2022/09/how-to-use-serverless-fucntions-with-ssr/): explains how to correctly split a function between the server/client part in Gatsby
- 📜 [Fastest Frontend Tooling in 2022](https://cpojer.net/posts/fastest-frontend-tooling-in-2022): Christoph Nakazawa justifies the choices behind his minimalist starter [vite-ts-react-tailwind-template](https://github.com/cpojer/vite-ts-react-tailwind-template)
- 📜 [Improving the accessibility of our Next.js site](https://vercel.com/blog/improving-the-accessibility-of-our-nextjs-site)
- 📜 [The Orton Effect - dreamy photo effect in CSS and React](https://mikebifulco.com/posts/orton-effect-css-react)
- 📜 [Mark Erikson - Guide to React Rendering Behavior - updated for React 18](https://twitter.com/acemarke/status/1577301648850014210)
- 🚧 [no-nested-components ESLint rule](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/25360): a new rule could come soon and avoid declaring components on the fly
- 🧵 [Dan Abramov - "skipping re-renders (eg with memo) is a performance optimization only"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575553047408902147)
- 🧵 [Andrew Clark - "We've looked very seriously at a WASM rewrite of React"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1576302675766804480)
- [React Spectrum - React Aria - October 4 releases](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1577370727849680896)
- 📦 [Redwood v3](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/redwood-3-0-0-is-now-available/3989) + [What's new in Redwood v3?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9LFWOxMlTs)
- 📦 [Supabase Pre-built React Auth UI](https://twitter.com/supabase/status/1577215238792916992)
segments.translated_content:
- 📖 React Beta文档更新：[useEffect](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575320847279071232) + [useId](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1577283961763467265) + ["所有常用API均已文档化"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575367224541560833)
- 📜 [如何将Serverless Functions与SSR结合使用](https://paulie.dev/posts/2022/09/how-to-use-serverless-fucntions-with-ssr/)：详解如何在Gatsby中正确拆分服务端/客户端函数逻辑
- 📜 [2022年最快的前端工具链](https://cpojer.net/posts/fastest-frontend-tooling-in-2022)：Christoph Nakazawa阐述其极简脚手架[vite-ts-react-tailwind-template](https://github.com/cpojer/vite-ts-react-tailwind-template)的技术选型
- 📜 [提升Next.js站点的可访问性实践](https://vercel.com/blog/improving-the-accessibility-of-our-nextjs-site)
- 📜 [Orton特效——用CSS和React实现梦幻照片效果](https://mikebifulco.com/posts/orton-effect-css-react)
- 📜 [Mark Erikson更新React渲染行为指南——适配React 18](https://twitter.com/acemarke/status/1577301648850014210)
- 🚧 [no-nested-components ESLint规则](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/25360)：新规则或将禁止动态声明组件
- 🧵 [Dan Abramov强调"跳过重渲染（如使用memo）仅是性能优化手段"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1575553047408902147)
- 🧵 [Andrew Clark透露"我们认真考虑过用WASM重写React"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1576302675766804480)
- [React Spectrum与React Aria发布10月4日更新](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1577370727849680896)
- 📦 [Redwood v3发布](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/redwood-3-0-0-is-now-available/3989) + [Redwood v3新特性解析](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9LFWOxMlTs)
- 📦 [Supabase推出预构建React Auth UI](https://twitter.com/supabase/status/1577215238792916992)

segments.content: [**React Brussels - IRL & Online React conference - 14 Oct 2022**](https://www.react.brussels/)
segments.sourceMdx: [**React Brussels - IRL & Online React conference - 14 Oct 2022**](https://www.react.brussels/)
segments.translated_content: [**React Brussels线下+线上会议——2022年10月14日**](https://www.react.brussels/)

segments.content: React Brussels is back for its first **Hybrid** edition to ever happen in the ❤️of Europe. Talks about the **trendiest tech and skills** (Playwright, WebVR, useEffect, Data Fetching, Remix …) will be on agenda; from some of the **brightest minds** in the React arena; namely :
segments.sourceMdx: React Brussels is back for its first **Hybrid** edition to ever happen in the ❤️of Europe. Talks about the **trendiest tech and skills** (Playwright, WebVR, useEffect, Data Fetching, Remix …) will be on agenda; from some of the **brightest minds** in the React arena; namely :
segments.translated_content: React Brussels首次采用**混合模式**回归，将在欧洲中心❤️举办。议程涵盖**前沿技术与技能**（Playwright、WebVR、useEffect、数据获取、Remix等），演讲嘉宾包括React领域的**顶尖专家**：

segments.content:
* Tejas Kumar: DevRel Director - **Xata**
* Kathleen McMahon: Sr Design System Eng - **Northwestern Mutual**
* David Khourshid: Founder - **Stately**
* Shaundai Person: Sr Software Eng - **Netflix**
* Debbie O'Brien: Sr Program Manager - **Microsoft**

segments.content: Afterparty, Contests, Job Opportunities, Belgian 🍺, Swag, City Tour ... all is there to last long beyond the conference itself !

segments.content: ## 📱 React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}
segments.translated_content: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: **[Reassure - Continuous App Performance Monitoring Made Simple](https://www.callstack.com/blog/app-performance-monitoring)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Reassure - Continuous App Performance Monitoring Made Simple](https://www.callstack.com/blog/app-performance-monitoring)**
segments.translated_content: **[Reassure——简化的应用性能持续监控方案](https://www.callstack.com/blog/app-performance-monitoring)**

segments.content: Callstack estimates 80% of performance problems on React-Native come from JS, and in particular from React misuse. They created Reassure, a new performance regression testing library. It integrates well with your CI to prevent the performance of your apps from degrading over time. The [web support](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/issues/39) is not yet available.
segments.sourceMdx: Callstack estimates 80% of performance problems on React-Native come from JS, and in particular from React misuse. They created Reassure, a new performance regression testing library. It integrates well with your CI to prevent the performance of your apps from degrading over time. The [web support](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/issues/39) is not yet available.
segments.translated_content: Callstack估计React-Native中80%的性能问题源自JavaScript，尤其是React的误用。为此他们开发了Reassure——一个全新的性能回归测试库。它能无缝集成到CI流程中，防止应用性能随时间推移而下降。目前[网页端支持](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/issues/39)尚未实现。

segments.content:
* 📒 [BAM Mobile Tech Radar 2022](https://www.bam.tech/en-tech-radar): a complete report on mobile development in 2022, with a big part on React-Native

segments.content: ## 🧑‍💻 Jobs
segments.sourceMdx: ## 🧑‍💻 Jobs {#jobs}
segments.translated_content: ## 🧑‍💻 工作机会 {#jobs}

segments.content: 🧑‍💼 [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied\&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)
segments.sourceMdx: 🧑‍💼 [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)
segments.translated_content: 🧑‍💼 [**Causal产品工程师，远程/伦敦/纽约，15-25万美元**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

segments.content: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.
segments.sourceMdx: Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.
segments.translated_content: Causal是由Coatue/Accel投资的A轮初创公司，致力于构建集数字处理与数据可视化于一体的工具。我们正在寻找能解决复杂UX/性能问题的资深React工程师。

segments.content: 🧑‍💼 [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20\&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)
segments.sourceMdx: 🧑‍💼 [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)
segments.translated_content: 🧑‍💼 [**G2i - 纯远程React Native职位**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

segments.content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is \~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe\_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
segments.sourceMdx: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
segments.translated_content: 我们开放多个React Native开发岗位！年薪约16万美元外加10%奖金。应聘者需具备RN生产环境经验且居住在美国。私信[@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i)了解详情，请注明通过This Week in React获知机会。
